# VZFileHandleSerialPortAttachment

**Class**

An attachment point that allows bidirectional communication using file handles.

## Declaration

```swift
class VZFileHandleSerialPortAttachment
```

## Overview

Use a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZFileHandleSerialPortAttachment] object to configure a serial port using separate file handles for reading and writing data. In your virtual machine, use the file handles in this object in the following way:

- To send data to the guest operating system, write data to the file handle in the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZFileHandleSerialPortAttachment/fileHandleForReading] property.
- To receive data from the guest operating system, read data from the file handle in the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZFileHandleSerialPortAttachment/fileHandleForWriting] property.

## Creating the attachment point

- **init(fileHandleForReading:fileHandleForWriting:)**: Creates a serial port attachment object from the specified file handles.

## Getting the file handles

- **fileHandleForReading**: The file handle that the guest operating system uses to read data.
- **fileHandleForWriting**: The file handle that the guest operating system uses to write data.

## Attachment points

- **VZFileSerialPortAttachment**: An attachment point that writes data from the guest system to a file.
- **VZSerialPortAttachment**: The common behaviors for the serial attachment points of your virtual machine.

## Inherits From

- VZSerialPortAttachment

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
